unnormalised: Mumbai, Oct 26: The Bombay High Court today adjourned the hearing in the copyright infringement case filed by Bollywood production house, Yash Raj Films (YRF), against a local music composer, Rajesh Khanna (not the actor), to Nov 15. YRF alleges that Khanna’s jingle for a local chai brand, "Chaiwala's Choice," is a blatant copy of their iconic song, "Mehendi Laga Ke Rakhna" from the film DDLJ (Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge).
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty six: The Bombay High Court today adjourned the hearing in the copyright infringement case filed by Bollywood production house, Yash Raj Films (Y-R-F), against a local music composer, Rajesh Khanna (not the actor), to November fifteen. Y-R-F alleges that Khanna’s jingle for a local chai brand, "Chaiwala's Choice," is a blatant copy of their iconic song, "Mehendi Laga Ke Rakhna" from the film D-D-L-J (Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge).

unnormalised: Adv. Priya Desai, representing YRF, argued that the similarities in melody and rhythm are undeniable. "The musical score is nearly identical. We are seeking an injunction to stop further broadcast and distribution of the 'Chaiwala's Choice' advertisement, as well as damages amounting to ₹10,00,000. This isn’t just about the money; it's about protecting intellectual property," she stated outside the courtroom.

unnormalised: Khanna’s lawyer, Adv. Sunil Verma, countered that the similarities are coincidental. "My client is a respected composer in his own right. The song is based on a common folk tune. YRF is simply trying to bully a smaller player," he told reporters. He added that the legal notice was initially served on Sept 2nd, 2024 and Khanna has been cooperating fully with the investigation.

unnormalised: This isn't the first time Bollywood has been embroiled in IP disputes. Several cases have been filed over the years, often involving allegations of plagiarism of music or storylines. The outcome of this case will be closely watched by the entertainment industry, particularly smaller content creators who often lack the resources to defend their work. The next hearing is scheduled for 11:00 AM on Nov 15. The Court is also examining similar suits, case ref: IPL-2022-147.

unnormalised: The "Chaiwala's Choice" ad campaign, featuring actor Irrfan Khan (unrelated to the composer), had quickly gained popularity across India, due in part to its catchy jingle. The legal action initiated by YRF has taken many in the media by surprise. The campaign was already planning a national rollout, investing over Rs. 5 Cr, but that has now been put on hold given the ongoing legal proceedings. The court is expected to examine all relevant documents before passing any orders.

unnormalised: Intellectual Property Lawyer, Adv. Rohan Sharma, commented, "Copyright infringement cases are tricky. The courts will consider several factors, including the originality of the work, the degree of similarity, and whether the alleged infringement is substantial. The burden of proof lies with YRF to demonstrate that Khanna's jingle is indeed a copy."
